name: Hotel Volcan Lanzarote

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have never been to Lanzarote before, and this hotel ensures we will be back time after time, there is nothing negative that you can say about the hotel, the staff , or facilities, we have had a tiresome few months and this hotel has regenerated out batteries, the location of the hotel is brilliant, the rooms are spacious and clean, the dining room is lovely eat in or out- which is inside or outside in the conservatory,food is good, the swimming pools are beautiful, all the staff are without exception helpful and courteous, the entrance prior to reception - the church is fantastic, we travelled with Thomas Cook who provide a twice weekly swap with voucher to 3 restaurants of which we tried 2 which were brilliant, if you dont like this hotel in my experience you are very hard to please would highly recommend this hotel to anyone
reviews.title: WONDERFUL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from an 11 night break at the Hotel Volcan. A fantastic location, rooms and the rest of the hotel were kept spotless, and the walk through to reception, especially if arriving after dark is pretty special. We also had lunch down by the pool a couple of times during our stay and that was excellent as well as being more favourably priced than some of the restaurants outside of the hotel. We took a walk up Montana Roja (an inactive volcano) on one of the cloudy days, went snorkeling, hired a pedalo and I went on an excursion with magma bikes canarias which are just situated around the corner. That was fantastic exploring Papagayo on a mountain bike with a very informed guide although my backside the day after thought differently. Definitely recommended for anyone interested in seeing the area- they also do walking tours too and have a stall on the twice weekly market.
reviews.title: Great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were just one or two tiny things that stopped the holiday from being even better. The quality of the parasols and sun longer mattresses are shocking. They are pretty much all dirty and could do with replacing. This was the case a year ago when we last stayed, and thought that this would have been a simple and quick thing to remedy, but it was apparent that these hadn't been changed.
reviews.title: Love this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was exceptional, especially as my better half is vegetarian and can often struggle to find suitable choice. This isn't the case here as there was everything you could wish for both at breakfast and evening meal. From cold meats and yogurt to the full English at breakfast to five or six salad choices and freshly cooked fish and meat at night time- the choice was exceptional. The difference compared to last year was that there appeared to be fewer waiters and waitresses employed which meant in quite lengthy delays in getting coffee in a morning and, to a lesser extent, drinks in the evening. It also meant that your plates, bowls and cutlery started to stack up on your table which is something I wouldn't have expected from a hotel where everything is spot on.
reviews.title: Coming back again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely recommended if you're after a relaxing, quite week or two away.
reviews.title: Lovely holiday experience

reviews.text: We came back to the hotel having stayed for a week in 2005, but that year were too tired to do anything bar the pool. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Excellent relaxing visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has an unusual layout, around the theme of being built in a volcano. The roof of the reception is shaped as a volcano cone, and the reception itself is at the top of a 3/4 story waterfall over volcanic rocks, accessed through an entrance hall of a church. The rooms are laid out in terraces over the hillside, which makes for a very peasant ambiance.
reviews.title: Volcan with a view

reviews.text: The hotel fronts onto the Rubicon marina, and is some 20/30 minutes walk from the main strip of Playa Blanca, along the promenade.That distance is no bad thing, since the strip is unattractive. The marina is a new development (2002?), very nicely laid out and has many good restaurants and bars. We were b&b in the hotel and used the excellent marina restaurants for meals, which is a good way to go.
reviews.title: Second visit, just as lovely and relaxing as the first ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms all have a small sitting area and a terrace or balcony - ours (269/267) led onto the kids pool terrace, but we were not bothered by noise. The main pool is shaped as a lagoon, which shelving sides and the buffet restaurant in the middle.
reviews.title: Great Chill Out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only meals we ate were breakfasts in the buffet, which provided a wide spread of cuisines, of high quality.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

reviews.text: Stayed here unexpectedly in June (after having to check out of another hotel in the middle of the night due to a cockroach issue!). The staff were really welcoming despite our impromptu arrival and got us settled really quickly. The next morning they offered to move us to a junior suite with no additional cost which was a really nice gesture as our holiday as gotten off to such a bad start!
reviews.title: Brilliant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were lovely and clean, the staff couldn't do more for us, the pool area was lovely and really spacious and the buffet in the restaurant had one of the best varieties I have ever seen (bucks fizz for breakfast every day was a real treat!).
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with amazing location
Club Volcano - just what I needed!
reviews.text: Only downsides were the temperature of the pool- I only ventured in once a day as it was so cold but I guess we were early in the season, and the birds in the restaurant (as others have mentioned) but neither would stop us visiting again.

Hotel Volcan has a wow factor right from the star. The church like entrance is certainly very unexpected and the entrance hall (under the huge Volcan dome) is almost like a tropical garden. It just instantly puts you in a holiday mood.
reviews.title: 5* - I don't think so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a sea view room which was absolutely lovely. The room was big, bright and clean with a great balcony. I enjoyed just sitting on the balcony in the mornings and taking the view in. In the evenings, we enjoyed seeing the sunset with a drink and it was all very tranquil.
reviews.title: Great Holiday - Relaxing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Volcan has a wow factor!! The church like entrance is certainly very impressive..the reception is in a Volcan dome which is amazing over looking a tropical garden with waterfalls. On arrival we were greeted with a very welcome free cocktail.
reviews.title: Fab place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bags & cases immediately taken to our room.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel and a Superb Experience
Reasonable Place
reviews.text: We upgraded to a sea view room which was absolutely great well worth the money. The room was huge immaculately clean,toiletries,robes & slippers( provided free)..the balcony we sat here most evenings before dinner taking in the amazing views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked half board and in my opinion, that is the best choice for the Volcan
reviews.title: Great relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is absolutely wondeful.. breakfast is great also offers a gluten free corner!! the waiting staff are so friendly and can't do enough for you.
reviews.title: sitting in reception waiting to leave!!

description: This luxury five star hotel, the Hotel Volcán Lanzarote, has a prime location on the seafront and together with the “Marina Rubicón” yachting harbour it constitutes a tourist resort in the southern part of the island - an area that forms part of the UNESCO’s “World Network of Biosphere Reserves”. The hotel is located just 10 km from the Timanfaya National Park, 900 metres from the picturesque fishing village of Playa Blanca, where you will find shopping centres, bars and restaurants, and just 30 minutes from the International Airport of Arrecife. Andrés Piñeiro, the chief architect of the project, chose a design based on a complex of classical buildings that are a true reflection of the typical architectural style of the island. The design of the hotel is reminiscent of a typical village of Lanzarote, with romantic patios, traditional courtyards and secluded spots, together with the magnificent hotel entrance which is a replica of the Teguise church of “Ntra. Sra. de Guadalupe”. With its unique architecture and the distinguished service of a luxury hotel, the Hotel Volcán Lanzarote is an icon within the high end segment of the tourism sector.
